verses.verse: And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> again<WH3254> did<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD,<WH3068> when Ehud<WH261> was dead.<WH4191>

And the LORD<WH3068> sold<WH4376> them into the hand<WH3027> of Jabin<WH2985> king<WH4428> of Canaan,<WH3667> that reigned<WH4427> in Hazor;<WH2674> the captain<WH8269> of whose host<WH6635> was Sisera,<WH5516> which dwelled<WH3427> in Harosheth<WH2800> of the Gentiles.<WH1471>

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH6817> to the LORD:<WH3068> for he had nine<WH8672> hundred<WH3967> chariots<WH7393> of iron;<WH1270> and twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> he mightily<WH2393> oppressed<WH3905> the children<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>
And Deborah,<WH1683> a prophetess,<WH5031> the wife<WH802> of Lapidoth,<WH3941> she judged<WH8199> Israel<WH3478> at that time.<WH6256>

And she dwelled<WH3427> under<WH8478> the palm<WH8560> tree of Deborah<WH1683> between<WH996> Ramah<WH7414> and Bethel<WH1008> in mount<WH2022> Ephraim:<WH669> and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came<WH5927> up to her for judgment.<WH4941>

And she sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> out of Kedeshnaphtali,<WH6943> <WH5321> and said<WH559> to him, Has not the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> commanded,<WH6680> saying, Go<WH3212> and draw<WH4900> toward mount<WH2022> Tabor,<WH8396> and take<WH3947> with you ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> of the children<WH1121> of Naphtali<WH5321> and of the children<WH1121> of Zebulun?<WH2074>

And I will draw<WH4900> to you to the river<WH5158> Kishon<WH7028> Sisera,<WH5516> the captain<WH8269> of Jabin's<WH2985> army,<WH6635> with his chariots<WH7393> and his multitude;<WH1995> and I will deliver<WH5414> him into your hand.<WH3027>
And Barak<WH1301> said<WH559> to her, If<WH518> you will go<WH3212> with me, then I will go:<WH1980> but if<WH518> you will not go<WH3212> with me, then I will not go.<WH3212>

And she said,<WH559> I will surely go<WH3212> with you: notwithstanding<WH657> the journey<WH1870> that you take<WH1980> shall not be for your honor;<WH8597> for the LORD<WH3068> shall sell<WH4376> Sisera<WH5516> into the hand<WH3027> of a woman.<WH802> And Deborah<WH1683> arose,<WH6965> and went<WH3212> with Barak<WH1301> to Kedesh.<WH6943>

And Barak<WH1301> called<WH2199> Zebulun<WH2074> and Naphtali<WH5321> to Kedesh;<WH6943> and he went<WH5927> up with ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> at his feet:<WH7272> and Deborah<WH1683> went<WH5927> up with him.

Now Heber<WH2268> the Kenite,<WH7014> which was of the children<WH1121> of Hobab<WH2246> the father<WH2859> in law<WH2859> of Moses,<WH4872> had severed<WH6504> himself from the Kenites,<WH7017> and pitched<WH5186> his tent<WH168> to the plain<WH436> of Zaanaim,<WH6815> which<WH834> is by Kedesh.<WH6943>
And they showed<WH5046> Sisera<WH5516> that Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> was gone<WH5927> up to mount<WH2022> Tabor.<WH8396>

And Sisera<WH5516> gathered<WH2199> together all<WH3605> his chariots,<WH7393> even nine<WH8672> hundred<WH3967> chariots<WH7393> of iron,<WH1270> and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> that were with him, from Harosheth<WH2800> of the Gentiles<WH1471> to the river<WH5158> of Kishon.<WH7028>

And Deborah<WH1683> said<WH559> to Barak,<WH1301> Up; for this<WH2088> is the day<WH3117> in which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> has delivered<WH5414> Sisera<WH5516> into your hand:<WH3027> is not the LORD<WH3068> gone<WH3318> out before<WH6440> you? So Barak<WH1301> went<WH3381> down<WH3381> from mount<WH2022> Tabor,<WH8396> and ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> after<WH310> him.

And the LORD<WH3068> discomfited<WH2000> Sisera,<WH5516> and all<WH3605> his chariots,<WH7393> and all<WH3605> his host,<WH4264> with the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719> before<WH6440> Barak;<WH1301> so that Sisera<WH5516> lighted<WH3381> down<WH3381> off<WH5921> his chariot,<WH4818> and fled<WH5127> away on his feet.<WH7272>

But Barak<WH1301> pursued<WH7291> after<WH310> the chariots,<WH7393> and after<WH310> the host,<WH4264> to Harosheth<WH2800> of the Gentiles:<WH1471> and all<WH3605> the host<WH4264> of Sisera<WH5516> fell<WH5307> on the edge<WH6310> of the sword;<WH2719> and there was not a man left.<WH7604>

However, Sisera<WH5516> fled<WH5127> away on his feet<WH7272> to the tent<WH168> of Jael<WH3278> the wife<WH802> of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite:<WH7017> for there was peace<WH7965> between<WH996> Jabin<WH2985> the king<WH4428> of Hazor<WH2674> and the house<WH1004> of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite.<WH7017>

And Jael<WH3278> went<WH3318> out to meet<WH7125> Sisera,<WH5516> and said<WH559> to him, Turn<WH5493> in, my lord,<WH113> turn<WH5493> in to me; fear<WH3372> not. And when he had turned<WH5493> in to her into the tent,<WH168> she covered<WH3680> him with a mantle.<WH8063>

And he said<WH559> to her, Give me, I pray<WH4994> you, a little<WH4592> water<WH4325> to drink;<WH8248> for I am thirsty.<WH6770> And she opened<WH6605> a bottle<WH4997> of milk,<WH2461> and gave him drink,<WH8248> and covered<WH3680> him.

Again he said<WH559> to her, Stand<WH5975> in the door<WH6607> of the tent,<WH168> and it shall be, when<WH518> any man<WH376> does come<WH935> and inquire<WH7592> of you, and say,<WH559> Is there any man<WH376> here?<WH6311> that you shall say,<WH559> No.<WH369>

Then Jael<WH3278> Heber's<WH2268> wife<WH802> took<WH3947> a nail<WH3489> of the tent,<WH168> and took<WH7760> an hammer<WH4718> in her hand,<WH3027> and went<WH935> softly<WH3814> to him, and smote<WH8628> the nail<WH3489> into his temples,<WH7541> and fastened<WH6795> it into the ground:<WH776> for he was fast asleep<WH7290> and weary.<WH5774> So he died.<WH4191>

And, behold,<WH2009> as Barak<WH1301> pursued<WH7291> Sisera,<WH5516> Jael<WH3278> came<WH3318> out to meet<WH7125> him, and said<WH559> to him, Come,<WH3212> and I will show<WH7200> you the man<WH376> whom<WH834> you seek.<WH1245> And when he came<WH935> into her tent, behold,<WH2009> Sisera<WH5516> lay<WH5307> dead,<WH4191> and the nail<WH3489> was in his temples.<WH7541>
So God<WH430> subdued<WH3665> on that day<WH3117> Jabin<WH2985> the king<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667> before<WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>

And the hand<WH3027> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> prospered,<WH1980> and prevailed<WH7186> against<WH5921> Jabin<WH2985> the king<WH4428> of Canaan,<WH3667> until<WH5704> they had destroyed<WH3772> Jabin<WH2985> king<WH4428> of Canaan.<WH3667>
